page.title: 10Dairy Farming
page.content: There are 3 Dairy Farms in this block and only 14 altogether in Caithness. The cows are Ayrshire or Friesian x Ayrshire and replacements are home- bred.They are milked twice per day. Two of the farms have parlours and the other has round the byre milking.The milk goes straight to the bulk tank and is collected daily by bulk tanker and taken to the N.of S.M.M.Board creamery at Wick. The cows are outside from June-Sept. and fed concentrates while being milked.The rest of the year they get a selection of barley,bale silage,hay, beet pulp,minerals and concentrates. The farms are family concerns with one farm employing a full-time dairyman and all of them using casual labour. Recently the farms have been subject to milk quotas.
